s.text: Of course, even Toobin's hypocrisy may not be enough to turn his book into a commercial success.
Of course, even Toobin's hypocrisy may not be enough to turn his book into a commercial success.
Of course, even Toobin's hypocrisy may not be enough to turn his book into a commercial success.
Would it have been OK to report on Clinton's sex life in all its moist detail if the press had only admitted the purpose was pure gossip?
So what does Toobin do to publicize his book?
The dust jacket for Toobin's book, A Vast Conspiracy , says it "analyzes the facts ...
In his new book rehashing the Lewinsky scandal, Jeffrey Toobin is disgusted by the "fixation on the personal" that leads journalists and others to investigate "the private lives of public people."
Of course, even Toobin's hypocrisy may not be enough to turn his book into a commercial success.
